page.title: 15Historical Buildings
page.content:
Most of these buildings can be found in the High Street. Starting at the north end with Dalkeith Palace, remodelled in 1701 from an earlier castle, you pass St Marys Chapel, built in 1845. Further along there is the Corn Exchange(1854) and the Tolbooth Hall(1827). Across the road lies St Nicholas Church, recorded as far back as 1372, restored in 1854.
Continuing onto Eskbank Road you would reach the War Memorial(1919) and the Water Tower(1879). Elsewhere are the Old Barracks erected in 1864 and used by both Police and the military. Nearby is Newbattle Abbey, founded in 1140. The present building was contracted in 1580 and includes many fine features. It is now a Residential Adult Education College.
